
### exercise (1)  {.smaller}


 
```
int main() {
    pid_t pids[2]; const char *args[] = {"echo", "ARG", NULL};
    const char *extra[] = {"L1", "L2"};
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        pids[i] = fork();
        if (pids[i] == 0) {
            args[1] = extra[i];
            execv("/bin/echo", args);
        }
    }
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        waitpid(pids[i], NULL, 0);
    }
}

```
  Assuming fork and execv do not fail, which are possible outputs? <table>
<tr><td><em></em> A.</td><td><code></code> L1\\shownewline{} L2</td><td><em></em> D.</td><td>A and B</td></tr>
<tr><td><em></em> B.</td><td><code></code> L1\\shownewline{} L2\\shownewline{} L2</td><td><em></em> E.</td><td>A and C</td></tr>
<tr><td><em></em> C.</td><td><code></code> L2\\shownewline{} L1</td><td><em></em> F.</td><td>all of the above</td></tr>
<tr><td>&nbsp;</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td><em></em> G.</td><td>something else</td></tr>
</table>

### exercise (2)  {.smaller}


 
```
int main() {
    pid_t pids[2]; const char *args[] = {"echo", "0", NULL};
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        pids[i] = fork();
        if (pids[i] == 0) { execv("/bin/echo", args); }
    }
    printf("1\n"); fflush(stdout);
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        waitpid(pids[i], NULL, 0);
    }
    printf("2\n"); fflush(stdout);
}

```
  Assuming fork and execv do not fail, which are possible outputs? <table>
<tr><td><em></em> A.</td><td><code></code> 0\\shownewline{} 0\\shownewline{} 1\\shownewline{} 2</td><td><em></em> E.</td><td>\\correct{A, B, and C}</td></tr>
<tr><td><em></em> B.</td><td><code></code> 0\\shownewline{} 1\\shownewline{} 0\\shownewline{} 2</td><td><em></em> F.</td><td>C and D</td></tr>
<tr><td><em></em> C.</td><td><code></code> 1\\shownewline{} 0\\shownewline{} 0\\shownewline{} 2</td><td><em></em> G.</td><td>all of the above</td></tr>
<tr><td><em></em> D.</td><td><code></code> 1\\shownewline{} 0\\shownewline{} 2\\shownewline{} 0</td><td><em></em> H.</td><td>something else</td></tr>
</table>
